body.p: For Greenplum Database 6, you can upgrade from PostGIS 2.1.5 to 2.5.4, or from a PostGIS 2.5.4 package to a newer PostGIS 2.5.4 package.
body.note: Before removing PostGIS support from a database, ensure that no users are accessing the database. Removing PostGIS support from a database drops PostGIS database objects from the database. Users accessing PostGIS objects might interfere with the dropping of PostGIS objects. See .

body.p:
You can perform these upgrades of a Greenplum PostGIS 2.5.4 package.
Upgrades the PostGIS pivotal.2 package to the pivotal.3 minor release package.
Upgrades the PostGIS package to the pivotal.2 minor release package. The minor release supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database.
Upgrades the PostGIS package to the build.2 maintenance release. The release is an ABI (Application Binary Interface) compatible PostGIS package that contains the same PostGIS version (2.5.4).

topic.title: Upgrading PostGIS 2.5.4 package from pivotal.1 or pivotal.2 to pivotal.3

body.p: Upgrading the installed PostGIS 2.5.4 package from pivotal.1 or pivotal.2 to pivotal.3 updates the PostGIS 2.5.4 to a new minor release pivotal.3 that uses the same PostGIS version (2.5.4).

ol.li: Confirm you have a PostGIS 2.5.4 package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1 or postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2 installed in a Greenplum Database system. See .

Upgrade the PostGIS package in the Greenplum Database system using the gppkg option -u. The command updates the package to the postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.3.build.1 package.gppkg -u postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.3.build.1-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

For all databases with PostGIS enabled, run the PostGIS 2.5.4 postgis_manager.sh script in the directory $GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.5 to upgrade PostGIS in that database. This command upgrades PostGIS that is enabled in the database mytest in the Greenplum Database system.$GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.5/postgis_manager.sh mytest upgrade

topic.title: Upgrading the postgis-2.5.4 Package from pivotal.1 to pivotal.2

body.p: Upgrading an installed PostGIS 2.5.4 package from pivotal.1 to pivotal.2 updates the Greenplum PostGIS 2.5.4 package to a minor release that uses the same PostGIS version (2.5.4). The PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2 package supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database. See .
Updating to pivotal.2 also requires converting PostGIS so that you can use the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database.

ol.li: Confirm you have a PostGIS 2.5.4 package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1 installed in a Greenplum Database system. See .
remove the package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1 from the system. This command removes a postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1 package from a Greenplum Database system.gppkg -r postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1.build.3

Install the PostGIS package in the Greenplum Database system using the gppkg option -i. This command install the package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2 package on a RedHat 7 or CentOS 7 system.$ gppkg -i postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

Run the following commands in all databases that have PostGIS 2.5.4 enabled. The commands update PostGIS to use the DROP EXTENSION command to remove PostGIS support from the database.
Do not run these commands in a database that does not have PostGIS enabled. Before running these commands, ensure that no users are accessing the database. The CREATE EXTENSION command updates a system catalog table. Other users concurrently accessing catalog tables might cause catalog corruption issues.# SET allow_system_table_mods TO on; # CREATE EXTENSION postgis SCHEMA public FROM unpackaged; # SET allow_system_table_mods TO off;
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

body.p: To enable PostGIS in a database after you have upgraded to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2 package, use the CREATE EXTENSION postgis command. To remove PostGIS support, use the DROP EXTENSION postgis CASCADE command.

topic.title: Upgrade the postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2 package from build.1 to build.2

body.p: You can upgrade the installed PostGIS package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.1 to postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2. The upgrade updates the PostGIS package (build.1) with an ABI (Application Binary Interface) compatible PostGIS package (build.2) that contains the same PostGIS version.

ol.li: Confirm you have PostGIS 2.5.4 package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.1 installed in a Greenplum Database system. See .

Remove the package postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.1 from the system. This command removes a postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.1 package from a Greenplum Database system.gppkg -r postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.1

Install PostGIS 2.5.4 to the build.2 package in the Greenplum Database system using the gppkg option -i. This command installs PostGIS on a RedHat 7 or CentOS 7 system.$ gppkg -i postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

body.p: Upgrading the Greenplum PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a postgis-2.5.4 package, requires removing PostGIS 2.1.5 support from databases with PostGIS enabled. Removing PostGIS support drops the PostGIS 2.1.5 objects from the database. Before removing PostGIS 2.1.5 support, ensure that no users are accessing the database. Removing PostGIS support from a database drops PostGIS database objects from the database. Users accessing PostGIS objects might interfere with dropping PostGIS objects.

You can perform these upgrades of a PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a Greenplum PostGIS 2.5.4 package.
The pivotal.3 package supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database. The package also improves support for upgrading PostGIS 2.5.4 packages.
The pivotal.2 package supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database.
The pivotal.1 package requires using a script to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database.
After upgrading the PostGIS package, you can remove the PostGIS 2.1.5 package.

topic.title: Upgrading from PostGIS 2.1.5 to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.3 Package

body.p: A PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.3 package contains PostGIS 2.5.4. Also, the PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.3 package supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database. DROP EXTENSION support is included starting with PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2.
body.note: Upgrading from a Greenplum PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.3 package requires running the PostGIS 2.5.4 postgis_manager.sh script. The script drops PostGIS 2.1.5 objects from the database and updates a catalog table. Before running the script, ensure that no users are accessing the database. Users accessing database objects might interfere with the upgrade.

ol.li: Confirm you have a PostGIS 2.1.5 package postgis-2.1.5+pivotal.1 installed in a Greenplum Database system. See .

Install the PostGIS 2.5.4 package into Greenplum Database system with the gppkg utility.gppkg -i postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.3.build.1-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

For all databases with PostGIS enabled, run the PostGIS 2.5.4 postgis_manager.sh script in the directory $GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.5 to upgrade PostGIS in that database. This command upgrades PostGIS that is enabled in the database mytest in the Greenplum Database system.$GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.5/postgis_manager.sh mytest upgrade
You can validate that the PostGIS 2.5 is enabled in the database with the postgis_version() function.

body.p: To enable PostGIS in a database after you have upgraded to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.3 package, use the CREATE EXTENSION postgis command. To remove PostGIS support, use the DROP EXTENSION postgis CASCADE command.

topic.title: Upgrading from PostGIS 2.1.5 to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2 Package

body.p: Upgrading an installed PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2 package updates the Greenplum PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a minor release that uses the PostGIS 2.5.4. Also, the PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.2 package supports using the CREATE EXTENSION command and the DROP EXTENSION command to enable and remove PostGIS support in a database. See .

ol.li: Confirm you have a PostGIS 2.1.5 package such as postgis-2.1.5+pivotal.2 installed in a Greenplum Database system and PostGIS 2.1.5 is enabled for a database. See .

Install the PostGIS 2.5.4 package into a Greenplum Database system with the gppkg utility. This gppkg command installs postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2.gppkg -i postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2.build.2-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

For all databases with PostGIS 2.1.5 enabled, remove PostGIS support from the database with the version 2.1.5 postgis_manager.sh script. This command removes support from the database mytest in the Greenplum Database system. $GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.1/postgis_manager.sh mytest uninstall
Enable PostGIS 2.5.4 support for a database with the CREATE EXTENSION command.# CREATE EXTENSION postgis;
You can validate that the PostGIS 2.5 is enabled in the database with the postgis_version() function.

topic.title: Upgrading from PostGIS 2.1.5 to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.1 Package

body.p: Upgrading an installed PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a PostGIS 2.5.4 pivotal.1 version package updates the Greenplum PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a package that uses the PostGIS 2.5.4.

ol.li: Confirm you have a PostGIS 2.1.5 package such postgis-2.1.5+pivotal.2 installed in a Greenplum Database system and PostGIS 2.1.5 is enabled for a database. See .

Install PostGIS 2.5.4 into a Greenplum Database system.gppkg -i postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.1.build.3-gp6-rhel7-x86_64.gppkg
Run the gppkg -q --all command to verify the updated package version is installed in the Greenplum Database system.

For all databases with PostGIS 2.1.5 enabled, remove PostGIS 2.1.5 support from database with the version 2.1.5 postgis_manager.sh script. This command removes support from the database mytest in the Greenplum Database system.$GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.1/postgis_manager.sh mytest uninstall

Enable PostGIS 2.5.4 support for a database with the 2.5.4 postgis_manager.sh script. This command enables support from the database mytest in the Greenplum Database system.$GPHOME/share/postgresql/contrib/postgis-2.5/postgis_manager.sh mytest install
You can validate that PostGIS 2.5 is enabled in the database with the postgis_version() function.

body.p: After upgrading the databases in the Greenplum Database system, you can remove the PostGIS 2.1.5 package from the system. This command removes the postgis-2.1.5+pivotal.2 package from a Greenplum Database system.gppkg -r postgis-2.1.5+pivotal.2
Run the gppkg -q --all command to list the installed Greenplum packages.

When upgrading PostGIS you must check the version of the Greenplum PostGIS package installed on the Greenplum Database system and the version of PostGIS enabled in the database.
Check the installed PostGIS package version with the gppkg utility. This command lists all installed Greenplum packages.$ gppkg -q --all
Check the enabled PostGIS version in a database with the postgis_version() function. This psql command displays the version PostGIS that is enabled for the database testdb. $ psql -d testdb -c 'select postgis_version();'
If PostGIS is not enabled for the database, Greenplum returns a function does not exist error.

Upgrading from a PostGIS 2.1.5 package to a PostGIS 2.5.4 package requires removing support for PostGIS 2.1.5 from a database with the postgis_manager.sh script. The script drops the PostGIS objects from the database that were created with PostGIS 2.1.5.

Starting with the postgis-2.5.4+pivotal.2 package, you enable support PostGIS for a database with the CREATE EXTENSION command. For previous PostGIS 2.5.4 packages and all PostGIS 2.1.5 packages, you use an SQL script.

Removing PostGIS support from a database drops PostGIS objects from the database. Dropping the PostGIS objects cascades to objects that reference the PostGIS objects. For example, this CREATE TABLE command creates a table with column b is defined with PostGIS geometry data type.# CREATE TABLE test(a int, b geometry) DISTRIBUTED RANDOMLY;

This is the table definition in a database with PostGIS enabled.# \d test Table "public.test" Column | Type | Modifiers --------+----------+----------- a | integer | b | geometry | Distributed randomly

This is the table definition in a database after PostGIS support has been removed.# \d test Table "public.test" Column | Type | Modifiers --------+---------+----------- a | integer | Distributed randomly
